adviseScripts.text: Are you all right, Commander?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I saw you having a really intense water fight with Neon by the beach earlier.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: You didn't hurt yourself, did you?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I'm just fine.
Actually, I did take a tumble and swallowed a mouthful of salt water.
Are you sure?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: You should know better than to lie to a doctor.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I clearly saw you fall into the water.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Considering how long you were under, you must be 90% filled with salt water by now.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: How about letting me take a look?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I knew it. I told you not to play in the water for too long.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Drinking too much seawater can make you dehydrated.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Come along, Commander.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: It's time to give you some treatment.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I obediently let Mary lead me to the clinic by hand.
Commander,
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: this might seem a bit random,
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: but what do you think of my swimsuit?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: It's sexy.
You're right, that is a bit out of left field.
You're nothing if not to the point, hehe.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: But I like this side of you, too.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Are you blushing?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: You're not too hot, are you? Is it because there's no A/C?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Mary and I have a nice conversation.
It sure is sweltering out here.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: What can I do
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: to beat the summer heat?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Nothing beats a nice iced coffee.
You can't go wrong with a cool slice of refreshing watermelon.
Now that you mention coffee, Commander,
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: you've been drinking that stuff like there's no tomorrow lately.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Too much caffeine is bad for the body.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: That's a great idea!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: If the weather's really blistering, having some watermelon can be good for you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: But you should really cut down on all the iced coffee you've been drinking.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I talk to Mary about ways to beat the summer heat.
I've prepared a quiz for you, Commander.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: The ocean is right before you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: The vast azure waters are glimmering invitingly.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: What do you do?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Do a few warm-up stretches and enter the water.
Dive in without any hesitation.
Very good! That's the correct answer.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Far too easy a question for someone as smart as you, isn't it?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Next time, I'll have to prepare a harder quiz for you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: If you do that,
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: you might end up passing out and waking up to an unfamiliar ceiling above you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: You'd ostensibly be diving straight into a bed at the clinic.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Is that what you want?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I review water safety procedures with Mary.
I don't know if it's because it's cooler in the clinic,
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: but we've had an influx of patients lately. It's rather disconcerting.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: What should I do to drive away those who aren't actually sick?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Rely on your trusty old needles.
Why not take the chance to give them a checkup?
We need to be careful with giving injections, Commander.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Of course, for those who are faking an illness, we can use IV drips and the like.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: But I believe there are other, more effective ways.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: That's a great idea!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: People usually don't like coming in for checkups, even when we offer them for free.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I could take this chance to scratch them off the list
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Thanks for the suggestion, Commander!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I talk with Mary about how to deal with malingerers.
Commander,
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: it seems you've got a little sunburn,
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Have you been using the sunscreen I gave you?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Every day.
I can't reach my back, so I haven't been putting it on.
Okay...
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I suppose there's not much we can do to avoid getting a little burnt, since the sun is so strong.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: If you need more, just let me know.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I'm not only talking about your back!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Come over here.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Is this the spot you were referring to?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Ouch!
Or here?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Ow...
I learn from Mary how effective sunscreen is against UV rays.
More and more people have been getting stung by jellyfish lately.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Typically, it's not a big deal, but you never know.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I've been telling everyone to be careful, but no one listens to me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: And it's not like I can capture the jellyfish... This is really quite worrisome.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Do you have any suggestions?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: How about putting up a warning sign that people won't miss?
Put your trust in me. I'll kill all the jellyfish.
A great idea as always, Commander. Good thing I asked you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: That shouldn't be too hard to pull off, and it will likely reduce the number of stings significantly.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I'll discuss with Pepper how to make that sign.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: That may be a bit extreme...
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: We don't want to kill off an entire species just because they pose an inconvenience.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Besides, I don't think that would really reduce the number of people getting stung.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text:
Moreover, we might find you washed up on the shore 
covered in jellyfish stings.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Mary and I learn about jellyfish.

Time flies by so quickly.
The sun is already setting.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: What do you think of when you see the sunset, Commander?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I feel as if I'm looking at a painting. It's beautiful.
I feel a bit melancholy.
I agree.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: It really is like looking at a painting. One with no imperfections.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: It's so magical, it's hard to believe that it's real life.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: You're so sentimental, Commander.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text:
I keep having the feeling that I've seen this view before,
back when I was living an ordinary life.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: But those times are long gone, much like the setting sun soon will be gone.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Hehe, I guess now that I think about it, I'm a bit melancholy myself. Of course, it bears mentioning that this entire view is artificial.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I watch the sunset with Mary.
I've always felt that Pepper is absolutely adorable.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Don't you agree?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Super cute. She follows you around like a puppy.
Eh, I dunno.
Ha, that she does.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I think she has become more clingy during this mission.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I wonder if Liter feels the same way about Volt?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Oh my, really?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I'm shocked that you don't find Pepper as cute as I do.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I have an earnest conversation with Mary about Pepper.
What illness should you be extra careful of during summer?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I'll give you a few hints: fever, headache, and chills.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: A cold.
The flu.
Another softball question, I see.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: The greater the temperature difference between day and night, the more wary you should be of potentially catching a cold.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Even though it's hot during the day, you should bring a jacket with you for when the sun goes down.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: ... Huh?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Flu season generally tends to be around autumn, Commander.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I see you did your research before coming here, though. How adorable, hehe.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I receive a free lesson from Mary on different illnesses.
I came across a shell with medicinal effects,
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: so I asked Neon to dig up a whole bunch of them for me. She got around 100!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Are you really going to need all of those?
Neon could do this kind of stuff in her sleep.
Hard to say,
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: but Neon certainly seemed happy.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: She hollered, "Neon: Impact!" and then took off running.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: It seems she really enjoys looking for shells, hehe.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: In fact, she ran off without putting on her swim ring...
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Actually, I should have Pepper go find her and give that to her.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Mary and I spend some time together, guessing how long Neon will be digging for shells.
Commander, what kind of color do you think I like?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: White.
Red.
Hehe. I knew you'd say that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Although I'm wearing a white swimsuit now,
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I actually don't really like white.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Oh, that's unexpected!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I thought you'd say another color.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: You're right: red is in fact my favorite color.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: It symbolizes warmth and passion. Kind of like the way you treat Nikkes. Hehe.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Mary and I talk about our favorite colors.
Which do you think I pull off better?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Swimsuits, or my usual attire?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Swimsuits, because of the novelty factor. We don't get to see you wearing something like this often.
Your usual attire.
Hehe,
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: you didn't have to justify your answer, Commander.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I guess I should show it off more often, so that it won't be such an uncommon sight.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: In that case, I should go and change.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Just joking, hehe!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Don't look so upset.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Mary and I share our opinions on her fashion style.
Commander, you know how important getting enough sleep is.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: But I heard that you've been staying up until late at night recently.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Why is that?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: ... It's hard for me to talk about.
I have too much work piled up.
Huh...
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Fair enough. You are an adult, after all.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I feel like I've created some kind of misunderstanding...
Good thing I asked.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Make sure to drop by the clinic tomorrow.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I'll give you a special prescription that'll get rid of all that fatigue in no time, hehe.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Guess I'll have to visit the clinic tomorrow.
Even if you're at the beach,
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: in vacation mode,
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: there are some things you shouldn't slack off on, don't you think?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I've been having so much fun that I haven't had time to rest properly.
... Sorry, I didn't hear you. What was that?
If you want to be healthy, resting is essential.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Make sure to take it easy today.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Goodness gracious!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Your stamina has hit rock bottom, no doubt due to the hot weather.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: You'd better have another checkup.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I once again learn the importance of resting.
People always say they don't like it when it's windy at the beach, because of the sand.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I don't think it's that bad though. I wonder why?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Maybe because your eyes are smaller, not as much sand gets in them?
Maybe your wide-brim hat shields you from the sand?
You think so?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: So if I open my eyes wide like this, I might find the wind uncomfortable too.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Hehe, I didn't startle you, did I, Commander?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: That could very well be the case.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I'm going to recommend hats like this to other people.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I spend some time with Mary picking out hats.
Doesn't Pepper look lovely
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: in her swimsuit?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I love it! Such a fresh and different look for her!
I prefer a bit more of a mature vibe.
Such an enthusiastic response.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I'll have to let Pepper know how you feel.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I can't wait for her reaction.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I assume that's directed toward me?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Thank you for the compliment, Commander.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I share my swimsuit preferences with Mary.
Pepper seems to be too much of a workaholic.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: She's been spreading herself far too thin.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: What can I do to make her rest?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: That's rich, coming from you.
I could fake an illness and lure her out of the clinic.
Hehe. I didn't expect to be called out like that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: All right then, how about we go for a walk tomorrow?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Are you telling me, a doctor, to lie?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: As much as I'd like to turn down your suggestion,
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I think that may well be the only way we can get Pepper to leave.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Mary and I make a plan to let Pepper rest.
Commander, do you enjoy
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: cold showers or hot showers more?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Cold showers.
Hot showers.
That settles it then!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Hyah!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: *Splash*
What the... what's this?
Since you're at the beach, you should try playing in the water at least once.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: It's good for your health too. This is called killing two birds with one stone, hehe.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Well, the seawater is a bit cold, but what can you do?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: *Splash*
Eek! That's freezing!
Mary runs away after splashing water all over me.
I have so much fun playing in the water with Mary that I forget about the time.
I just don't understand how someone can be injured so severely, without even knowing it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I'll be more careful next time.
I didn't want to lose to Neon in the water gun fight...
Pain is a signal sent to the body, telling it to flee from the current situation.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: You say you'll be more careful in the future. I hope that's true.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Seems like you had quite an intense battle.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Still, you should take better care of yourself.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I receive both gentle treatment and a harsh scolding from Mary.
